thread.title: Frustrated Cavs fall to short-handed Mavericks | NBA | Sporting News
thread.title_full: Frustrated Cavs fall to short-handed Mavericks | NBA | Sporting News

author: Nba Australia
title: Frustrated Cavs fall to short-handed Mavericks | NBA | Sporting News
text:
January 31, 2017 12:17am EST January 30, 2017 11:47pm EST The Cavs' January record sits at 7-8 NBA Australia 
Published on Jan. 30, 2017 | Updated on Jan. 31, 2017 
Jan. 30, 2017 
The Dallas Mavericks followed up their big win over San Antonio with an equally impressive 104-97 win over the defending champion Cleveland Cavaliers. 
MORE: Sixers continue good form with narrow win over Sacramento 
With Kevin Love out with a back injury, Tristan Thompson struggled to fill the void, getting in early foul trouble which left the Cavs thin up front. 
The Cavs struggled on both sides of the floor, with several defensive lapses in the third quarter heping the Mavericks blow their lead to 11 heaidng into the fourth. 
After Channing Frye nailed back-to-back triples, the Cavs cut things to just seven points, but the Mavs found another gear eventually blowing the game out to a 17-point lead. 
Harrison Barnes led the way with a game-high 24 points and 11 rebounds, but the story of the day belonged to Yogi Ferrell who dropped 19 points, five rebounds, three assists and five steals. , just days after being recalled from the D-League. 
LeBron finsihed with 23 points on 9-of-19 shooting, nine assists and nine rebounds. 
The Cavs will now try and bounce back at home against the Minnesota Timberwolves.
